title: Time Savings When Working from Home
authors: Aksoy, C. G.; Barrero, J. M.; Bloom, N.; Davis, S. J.; Dolls, M.; Zarate, P.
relevance_note: Quantifies commute-time savings from remote work across 27 countries and estimates how saved time is reallocated to work vs leisure; critical for measuring labor output effects.
key_finding: Workers save 72 minutes/day on average from commuting; 40% reallocated to work

title: Remote Work Employee Mix and Performance
authors: Aksoy, C. G.; Bloom, N.; Davis, S. J.; Marino, V.; Özgüzel, C.
relevance_note: Natural experiment on fully remote call center workforce showing productivity gains and workforce composition shifts.
key_finding: Fully remote workers 13% more productive but firm attracted different worker profile

title: The Rise of Remote Work: Evidence on Productivity and Preferences from Firm and Worker Surveys
authors: Bartik, A.; Cullen, Z.; Glaeser, E.; Luca, M.; Stanton, C.
relevance_note: Firm and worker survey evidence on productivity perceptions and persistence of remote work post-COVID.
key_finding: 45% of workers report higher productivity at home; firms expect 40% remote persistence

title: Hybrid Working from Home Improves Retention without Damaging Performance
authors: Bloom, N.; Han, R.; Liang, J.
relevance_note: Randomized control trial showing hybrid work reduces attrition without harming performance; high-quality causal evidence.
key_finding: Hybrid work reduced attrition by 33% with no performance loss

title: Productivity and Remote Work
relevance_note: Industry-level analysis linking remote work share to total factor productivity growth.
key_finding: Industries with higher remote work share showed 1.1% higher TFP growth

title: State of Remote Work 2023
relevance_note: Large global survey on remote worker perceptions of productivity engagement and work structure.
key_finding: 98% want to work remotely at least some of the time for rest of career

title: Cisco Global Hybrid Work Study 2025
relevance_note: Global employer/employee survey reporting self-assessed productivity impacts of hybrid policies.
key_finding: 78% report improved wellbeing from hybrid work; 83% say productivity same or better

title: Investigating the Role of Remote Working on Employees' Performance and Well-Being: An Evidence-Based Systematic Review
authors: Ferrara, B.; Pansini, M.; De Vincenzi, C.; Buonomo, I.; Benevene, P.
venue: International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health
relevance_note: Systematic review synthesizing empirical findings on remote work's effects on employee performance and wellbeing.
key_finding: Work-life balance and autonomy key mediators; isolation a consistent risk factor

title: Impact of Working from Home on Employee Productivity in Post COVID-19 Era: The Moderating Role of Organizational Support
authors: Adomako, K.; Agor, P. A.; Terkpertey, D. T.; Mensah, D.; Akakposu, L. Y.; Dwomoh, A. Y.
venue: World Journal of Advanced Research and Reviews
relevance_note: Examines relationship between remote work and productivity with organizational support as moderator.
key_finding: Organizational support significantly moderates remote work-productivity relationship

title: Work from Home and Productivity: Evidence from Personnel and Analytics Data on Information Technology Professionals
authors: Gibbs, M.; Mengel, F.; Siemroth, C.
relevance_note: High-frequency personnel data showing productivity declines during full remote shift among IT professionals.
key_finding: Output per hour fell 8-19%; total hours rose but effective work time declined

title: The Evolution of Work from Home
authors: Barrero, J. M.; Bloom, N.; Davis, S. J.
relevance_note: Macro-level evolution of work-from-home adoption and productivity perceptions.
key_finding: WFH stabilized at 25-30% of paid workdays; employers and workers learned WFH best practices

title: Remote Staff Hours Fall but Productivity Steady (For Now)
relevance_note: ATUS-based evidence showing reduced hours but steady output per worker via improved job matching.
key_finding: Remote workers average 2.5 fewer hours/week but output per worker unchanged

title: Assessing the Causal Relationship of Remote Work and Employee Productivity – A Study of Corporate Malaysia
authors: Lim, B. S. W.; Ainin, S.; Zakaria, N.; Foo, S. M.
relevance_note: PLS-SEM study linking technology availability and wellbeing to productivity under remote work.
key_finding: Technology availability and employee wellbeing significantly predict productivity

title: Exploring the Impact of Remote Work on Productivity: A Systematic Review
authors: Prasad, S.; Arahant, A.; Kaushik, A.
relevance_note: Systematic review synthesizing productivity determinants under remote work conditions.
key_finding: Flexibility and autonomy consistently positive; isolation and overwork negative

title: Supporting the Productivity and Wellbeing of Remote Workers: Lessons from COVID-19
authors: George, T. J.; Atwater, L. E.; Maneethai, D.; Madera, J. M.
relevance_note: Examines stress wellbeing and productivity outcomes in abrupt remote transitions during COVID.
key_finding: Manager support and clear communication critical for remote worker wellbeing and performance
